articles.title: Hi, I'm Sherry!
articles.description: Assistant Vice President at M&T Bank
articles.contents:
I currently work as a Senior Business Analytics and Reporting Analyst at
M&T Bank. I graduated from Swarthmore College
in 2023, where I majored in Mathematics + Statistics and minored in CS and
Chinese. My professional interests lie in data analysis and data science. I am
always interested in making connections with others who share similar interests
and building a strong and diverse network as I begin pursuing a career. Please
feel free to reach out if you would like to connect!

articles.title: Resume
articles.contents:
Work Experience
M&T Bank
Senior Business Analytics & Reporting Analyst
New York, NY (June 2024 - Present)
Assistant Vice President with the Community Banking division
Utilize Tableau, Python, and Excel for data intelligence and analysis on M&T’s
performance within the community
Analyze and report data on established and prospective customers, competitors,
and market disruption events in \(15+\) states in M&T’s footprint
Maintain and deliver \(30+\) reports monthly across departments to use in making
organizational decisions
Enhance and automate over \(10\) dashboards and \(25\) ad hoc reports, saving \(~250\)
hours of monthly labor
Management Trainee
Baltimore, MD (August 2023 - June 2024)
Management Development Program associate with the Community Banking division
Participated in professional development training monthly, ranging
from DEI topics to technical skill curricula to leadership competencies
Completed an innovation project sprint to find best solution for managing
digitally originated leads at M&T Bank
Projects
Innovation Sprint at M&T Bank
Baltimore, MD (February 2024 - June 2024)
Worked in a cross-functional team to find a solution to manage digitally
originated leads at M&T Bank
Learned about and actively utilized human-centered design and the innovation
sprint process during the project
Conducted interviews with \(50+\) customers and subject matter experts in Retail,
Business Banking, and Wealth Management to better understand their frictions and
pain points with lead management
Developed and refined \(10\) concepts and prototypes, resulting in a lead scoring
model that would allow M&T Bank to prioritize leads in a consistent manner,
increase deposit share, and expand cross-selling opportunities at a low cost
Presented final lead scoring concept to \(7\) Executive Vice Presidents and
\(100+\) audience members
Research Intern at The Eviction Lab
Princeton, NJ (May 2022 - April 2023)
Conducted research on eviction practices to better understand differences in
eviction rates across 8 buildings in Philadelphia
Analyzed and compared mobility patterns across these buildings using knowledge in
R, networks, and clustering
Wrote RStudio scripts to extract and clean data on residents in specific buildings from
multiple data sets with over 5000 lines
Designed and implemented an interactive data visualization app
that depicts mobility across buildings and zip codes; shows similar mobility
patterns across buildings with different eviction rates
Findings suggest that abusive management is causing high eviction rates in these
buildings. Ultimately, this will give policymakers leverage in reducing the toll
of mass evictions on their communities
Research Assistant with Professor Amanda Luby
Swarthmore, PA (June 2021 - December 2021)
Conducted research to better understand the accuracy of 165+ forensic fingerprint
examiners’ results on 300+ distinct latent prints
Navigated through FBI published White Box and Black Box data sets to obtain
information on imputation bias, the idea where examiners change their minutiae
markings on the prints to support their own conclusions
Created interactive graphs
to depict discrepancies in examiners’ minutiae markings between stages of examination
Applied hierarchical models to predict examiners’ minutiae movements based on
difficulty and clarity of print
Findings suggest that current forensic fingerprint examination techniques allow
for imputation bias during print examinations. Standardizing the process allows
transparency in the process and can minimize imputation bias
Wrote paper on findings; candidate for Undergraduate Statistics Project Competition
in Fall 2021
Co-authored refereed proceeding with Amanda Luby and Thomas Daillak titled
``Analyzing Spatial Responses: A Comparison of IRT-Based Approaches’’
Skills
Technical
Python
Tableau
R and RStudio
LaTeX
C++
C
SQL
Power BI
Wolfram Mathematica
Languages
English (native)
Mandarin (native)
Spanish (beginner)
Education
Swarthmore College
Swarthmore, PA (August 2019 - May 2023)
Major: Mathematics with an emphasis in Statistics
Minors: Computer Science, Chinese
Awards: QuestBridge Scholar, Heinrich W. Brinkmann Mathematics Prize, Morris
Monsky Prize in Mathematics, Richard Rubin Scholar
Fort Plain Jr./Sr. High School
Fort Plain, NY (September 2013 - June 2019)
Graduated Salutatorian
Awards: QuestBridge Prep Scholar and Finalist, DAR Good Citizens Award,
University at Albany Multicultural Award High School Achiever
College Positions
Statistics Mentor
Swarthmore College Math/Stat Department (August 2022 - May 2023)
Actively reviewed materials and assignments with students in STAT 011
(Statistical Methods I), STAT 021 (Statistical Methods II), STAT 051 (Probability),
and MATH 043/044 (Differential Equations)
Assisted professors in addressing questions from 70 students regarding challenging
problems during weekly lectures
Computer Science Mentor
Swarthmore College Computer Science Department (August 2020 - May 2023)
Quickly identified problem spots in students’ programs and encourage appropriate
solutions
Ran weekly help sessions attended by 20-30 students enrolled in introductory
Python and C++ courses
Statistics Tutor
Swarthmore College (January 2022 - May 2023)
Tutored students taking STAT 011 (Statistical Methods I) and STAT 021 (Statistical
Methods II)
Helped individual students understand concepts such as inference, confidence
intervals, etc.
Grader
Swarthmore College (Spring 2021, Fall 2022)
Graded for STAT 011 (Statistical Methods I) and CPSC 088 (Security & Privacy)
Proactively provide feedback to professors regarding struggling students
Student Academic Mentor
Swarthmore College (August 2020 - May 2022)
Provided academic advice and support for all students of Swarthmore College
during both remote and in-person semesters
Planned weekly events for first-year students to aid their transition to college
Worked closely with the program director and a cohort of other mentors to best
support the student body
English Tutor
Century Bridge, Taiwan (November 2019 - April 2023)
Individually tutored students ranging from three years old to adults in English
Adapted teaching styles unique to each student’s needs and abilities
Helped individual students learn vocabulary and grammar, prepare for TOEFL and
IELTS exams, and/or participate in discussion topics
Community and Leadership
QuestBridge: Community Engagement Chair
Swarthmore College (August 2022 - May 2023)
Collaborated with 11 other board members to manage a budget of over $1300 to
host career development, community building, and mentorship events for all
first generation low-income students at Swarthmore College
Drafted, edited, and proofread flyers, posters, and emails for accuracy,
typos and structure
Used Canva to create social content on Instagram
that amplified both QuestBridge and Swarthmore College’s mission
Gender Minorities in Math & Stat: Board Member
Swarthmore College (August 2021 - May 2022)
Collaborated with 4 other board members in order to foster acceptance, build
community, and improve support for all students at Swarthmore College, particularly
gender minority students in the Math/Stat Department
Managed a budget of $1500 to support workshops, meetings, and discussions about
diversity; increased membership by 90% throughout the course of the year

articles.title: Sherry Huang
articles.contents:
Sherry Huang
          
          
          Home
          
          
          CV
           
          ▾
          
          
          Resume
          Courses
          
          
          Blogs
          About Me
          ☰
          
          
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Sherry Huang
            
            
              
                
                    
                      
                        LinkedIn
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        GitHub
                      
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      
                        Email
                      
                    
                  
                                  
            
          
        
        
        
          
            I currently work as a Senior Business Analytics and
            Reporting Analyst at M&T Bank. I graduated from Swarthmore College in May
            2023, where I majored in Mathematics with an emphasis in
            Statistics and minored in Computer Science and Chinese. My
            professional interests lie in data analysis and data
            science.
            I completed the Management Development Program at M&T
            Bank from 2023-2024, a year-long non-rotational training
            program that involves an innovation project, leadership
            skills training, and networking opportunities. In Summer
            2022, I worked on a project with the Eviction Lab at Princeton
            University analyzing buildings with high eviction filing
            rates, as well as mobility in and out of these buildings. In
            Summer 2021, I worked on a project with Professor
            Amanda Luby (previously Swarthmore College, now Carleton
            College) examining imputation bias in minutiae markings by
            fingerprint examiners. My hobbies include reading, going for
            runs, and bullet
            journaling.
            I am always interested in making connections with others
            who share similar interests and building a strong and
            diverse network as I begin pursuing a career. Please feel
            free to reach out if you would like to connect!
          
        
      
    

    
      
        
          
            
              
            
              Sherry Huang
            
            
              
                
                                    
                    
                      LinkedIn
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      GitHub
                    
                  
                                    
                    
                      Email
